9154  return resultPlottable;
9155 }
9156 
9162 bool QCustomPlot::hasPlottable(QCPAbstractPlottable *plottable) const
9163 {
9164  return mPlottables.contains(plottable);
9165 }
9166 
9175 QCPGraph *QCustomPlot::graph(int index) const
9176 {
9177  if (index >= 0 && index < mGraphs.size())
9178  {
9179  return mGraphs.at(index);
9180  } else
9181  {
9182  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9183  return 0;
9184  }
9185 }
9186 
9194 QCPGraph *QCustomPlot::graph() const
9195 {
9196  if (!mGraphs.isEmpty())
9197  {
9198  return mGraphs.last();
9199  } else
9200  return 0;
9201 }
9202 
9215 QCPGraph *QCustomPlot::addGraph(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis)
9216 {
9217  if (!keyAxis) keyAxis = xAxis;
9218  if (!valueAxis) valueAxis = yAxis;
9219  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis)
9220  {
9221  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "can't use default QCustomPlot xAxis or yAxis, because at least one is invalid (has been deleted)";
9222  return 0;
9223  }
9224  if (keyAxis->parentPlot() != this || valueAxis->parentPlot() != this)
9225  {
9226  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "passed keyAxis or valueAxis doesn't have this QCustomPlot as parent";
9227  return 0;
9228  }
9229 
9230  QCPGraph *newGraph = new QCPGraph(keyAxis, valueAxis);
9231  if (addPlottable(newGraph))
9232  {
9233  newGraph->setName("Graph "+QString::number(mGraphs.size()));
9234  return newGraph;
9235  } else
9236  {
9237  delete newGraph;
9238  return 0;
9239  }
9240 }
9241 
9251 bool QCustomPlot::removeGraph(QCPGraph *graph)
9252 {
9253  return removePlottable(graph);
9254 }
9255 
9260 bool QCustomPlot::removeGraph(int index)
9261 {
9262  if (index >= 0 && index < mGraphs.size())
9263  return removeGraph(mGraphs[index]);
9264  else
9265  return false;
9266 }
9267 
9275 int QCustomPlot::clearGraphs()
9276 {
9277  int c = mGraphs.size();
9278  for (int i=c-1; i >= 0; --i)
9279  removeGraph(mGraphs[i]);
9280  return c;
9281 }
9282 
9288 int QCustomPlot::graphCount() const
9289 {
9290  return mGraphs.size();
9291 }
9292 
9301 QList<QCPGraph*> QCustomPlot::selectedGraphs() const
9302 {
9303  QList<QCPGraph*> result;
9304  for (int i=0; i<mGraphs.size(); ++i)
9305  {
9306  if (mGraphs.at(i)->selected())
9307  result.append(mGraphs.at(i));
9308  }
9309  return result;
9310 }
9311 
9320 QCPAbstractItem *QCustomPlot::item(int index) const
9321 {
9322  if (index >= 0 && index < mItems.size())
9323  {
9324  return mItems.at(index);
9325  } else
9326  {
9327  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9328  return 0;
9329  }
9330 }
9331 
9339 QCPAbstractItem *QCustomPlot::item() const
9340 {
9341  if (!mItems.isEmpty())
9342  {
9343  return mItems.last();
9344  } else
9345  return 0;
9346 }
9347 
9356 bool QCustomPlot::addItem(QCPAbstractItem *item)
9357 {
9358  if (!mItems.contains(item) && item->parentPlot() == this)
9359  {
9360  mItems.append(item);
9361  return true;
9362  } else
9363  {
9364  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "item either already in list or not created with this QCustomPlot as parent:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(item);
9365  return false;
9366  }
9367 }
9368 
9376 bool QCustomPlot::removeItem(QCPAbstractItem *item)
9377 {
9378  if (mItems.contains(item))
9379  {
9380  delete item;
9381  mItems.removeOne(item);
9382  return true;
9383  } else
9384  {
9385  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "item not in list:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(item);
9386  return false;
9387  }
9388 }
9389 
9394 bool QCustomPlot::removeItem(int index)
9395 {
9396  if (index >= 0 && index < mItems.size())
9397  return removeItem(mItems[index]);
9398  else
9399  {
9400  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9401  return false;
9402  }
9403 }
9404 
9412 int QCustomPlot::clearItems()
9413 {
9414  int c = mItems.size();
9415  for (int i=c-1; i >= 0; --i)
9416  removeItem(mItems[i]);
9417  return c;
9418 }
9419 
9425 int QCustomPlot::itemCount() const
9426 {
9427  return mItems.size();
9428 }
9429 
9435 QList<QCPAbstractItem*> QCustomPlot::selectedItems() const
9436 {
9437  QList<QCPAbstractItem*> result;
9438  for (int i=0; i<mItems.size(); ++i)
9439  {
9440  if (mItems.at(i)->selected())
9441  result.append(mItems.at(i));
9442  }
9443  return result;
9444 }
9445 
9459 QCPAbstractItem *QCustomPlot::itemAt(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable) const
9460 {
9461  QCPAbstractItem *resultItem = 0;
9462  double resultDistance = mSelectionTolerance; // only regard clicks with distances smaller than mSelectionTolerance as selections, so initialize with that value
9463 
9464  for (int i=0; i<mItems.size(); ++i)
9465  {
9466  QCPAbstractItem *currentItem = mItems[i];
9467  if (onlySelectable && !currentItem->selectable()) // we could have also passed onlySelectable to the selectTest function, but checking here is faster, because we have access to QCPAbstractItem::selectable
9468  continue;
9469  if (!currentItem->clipToAxisRect() || currentItem->clipRect().contains(pos.toPoint())) // only consider clicks inside axis cliprect of the item if actually clipped to it
9470  {
9471  double currentDistance = currentItem->selectTest(pos, false);
9472  if (currentDistance >= 0 && currentDistance < resultDistance)
9473  {
9474  resultItem = currentItem;
9475  resultDistance = currentDistance;
9476  }
9477  }
9478  }
9479 
9480  return resultItem;
9481 }
9482 
9488 bool QCustomPlot::hasItem(QCPAbstractItem *item) const
9489 {
9490  return mItems.contains(item);
9491 }
9492 
9501 QCPLayer *QCustomPlot::layer(const QString &name) const
9502 {
9503  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
9504  {
9505  if (mLayers.at(i)->name() == name)
9506  return mLayers.at(i);
9507  }
9508  return 0;
9509 }
9510 
9517 QCPLayer *QCustomPlot::layer(int index) const
9518 {
9519  if (index >= 0 && index < mLayers.size())
9520  {
9521  return mLayers.at(index);
9522  } else
9523  {
9524  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "index out of bounds:" << index;
9525  return 0;
9526  }
9527 }
9528 
9532 QCPLayer *QCustomPlot::currentLayer() const
9533 {
9534  return mCurrentLayer;
9535 }
9536 
9547 bool QCustomPlot::setCurrentLayer(const QString &name)
9548 {
9549  if (QCPLayer *newCurrentLayer = layer(name))
9550  {
9551  return setCurrentLayer(newCurrentLayer);
9552  } else
9553  {
9554  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer with name doesn't exist:" << name;
9555  return false;
9556  }
9557 }
9558 
9567 bool QCustomPlot::setCurrentLayer(QCPLayer *layer)
9568 {
9569  if (!mLayers.contains(layer))
9570  {
9571  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(layer);
9572  return false;
9573  }
9574 
9575  mCurrentLayer = layer;
9576  return true;
9577 }
9578 
9584 int QCustomPlot::layerCount() const
9585 {
9586  return mLayers.size();
9587 }
9588 
9602 bool QCustomPlot::addLayer(const QString &name, QCPLayer *otherLayer, QCustomPlot::LayerInsertMode insertMode)
9603 {
9604  if (!otherLayer)
9605  otherLayer = mLayers.last();
9606  if (!mLayers.contains(otherLayer))
9607  {
9608  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "otherLayer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(otherLayer);
9609  return false;
9610  }
9611  if (layer(name))
9612  {
9613  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "A layer exists already with the name" << name;
9614  return false;
9615  }
9616 
9617  QCPLayer *newLayer = new QCPLayer(this, name);
9618  mLayers.insert(otherLayer->index() + (insertMode==limAbove ? 1:0), newLayer);
9619  updateLayerIndices();
9620  return true;
9621 }
9622 
9637 bool QCustomPlot::removeLayer(QCPLayer *layer)
9638 {
9639  if (!mLayers.contains(layer))
9640  {
9641  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(layer);
9642  return false;
9643  }
9644  if (mLayers.size() < 2)
9645  {
9646  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "can't remove last layer";
9647  return false;
9648  }
9649 
9650  // append all children of this layer to layer below (if this is lowest layer, prepend to layer above)
9651  int removedIndex = layer->index();
9652  bool isFirstLayer = removedIndex==0;
9653  QCPLayer *targetLayer = isFirstLayer ? mLayers.at(removedIndex+1) : mLayers.at(removedIndex-1);
9654  QList<QCPLayerable*> children = layer->children();
9655  if (isFirstLayer) // prepend in reverse order (so order relative to each other stays the same)
9656  {
9657  for (int i=children.size()-1; i>=0; --i)
9658  children.at(i)->moveToLayer(targetLayer, true);
9659  } else // append normally
9660  {
9661  for (int i=0; i<children.size(); ++i)
9662  children.at(i)->moveToLayer(targetLayer, false);
9663  }
9664  // if removed layer is current layer, change current layer to layer below/above:
9665  if (layer == mCurrentLayer)
9666  setCurrentLayer(targetLayer);
9667  // remove layer:
9668  delete layer;
9669  mLayers.removeOne(layer);
9670  updateLayerIndices();
9671  return true;
9672 }
9673 
9683 bool QCustomPlot::moveLayer(QCPLayer *layer, QCPLayer *otherLayer, QCustomPlot::LayerInsertMode insertMode)
9684 {
9685  if (!mLayers.contains(layer))
9686  {
9687  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "layer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(layer);
9688  return false;
9689  }
9690  if (!mLayers.contains(otherLayer))
9691  {
9692  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "otherLayer not a layer of this QCustomPlot:" << reinterpret_cast<quintptr>(otherLayer);
9693  return false;
9694  }
9695 
9696  mLayers.move(layer->index(), otherLayer->index() + (insertMode==limAbove ? 1:0));
9697  updateLayerIndices();
9698  return true;
9699 }
9700 
9710 int QCustomPlot::axisRectCount() const
9711 {
9712  return axisRects().size();
9713 }
9714 
9724 QCPAxisRect *QCustomPlot::axisRect(int index) const
9725 {
9726  const QList<QCPAxisRect*> rectList = axisRects();
9727  if (index >= 0 && index < rectList.size())
9728  {
9729  return rectList.at(index);
9730  } else
9731  {
9732  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid axis rect index" << index;
9733  return 0;
9734  }
9735 }
9736 
9742 QList<QCPAxisRect*> QCustomPlot::axisRects() const
9743 {
9744  QList<QCPAxisRect*> result;
9745  QStack<QCPLayoutElement*> elementStack;
9746  if (mPlotLayout)
9747  elementStack.push(mPlotLayout);
9748 
9749  while (!elementStack.isEmpty())
9750  {
9751  QList<QCPLayoutElement*> subElements = elementStack.pop()->elements(false);
9752  for (int i=0; i<subElements.size(); ++i)
9753  {
9754  if (QCPLayoutElement *element = subElements.at(i))
9755  {
9756  elementStack.push(element);
9757  if (QCPAxisRect *ar = qobject_cast<QCPAxisRect*>(element))
9758  result.append(ar);
9759  }
9760  }
9761  }
9762 
9763  return result;
9764 }
9765 
9775 QCPLayoutElement *QCustomPlot::layoutElementAt(const QPointF &pos) const
9776 {
9777  QCPLayoutElement *current = mPlotLayout;
9778  bool searchSubElements = true;
9779  while (searchSubElements && current)
9780  {
9781  searchSubElements = false;
9782  const QList<QCPLayoutElement*> elements = current->elements(false);
9783  for (int i=0; i<elements.size(); ++i)
9784  {
9785  if (elements.at(i) && elements.at(i)->realVisibility() && elements.at(i)->selectTest(pos, false) >= 0)
9786  {
9787  current = elements.at(i);
9788  searchSubElements = true;
9789  break;
9790  }
9791  }
9792  }
9793  return current;
9794 }
9795 
9803 QList<QCPAxis*> QCustomPlot::selectedAxes() const
9804 {
9805  QList<QCPAxis*> result, allAxes;
9806  QList<QCPAxisRect*> rects = axisRects();
9807  for (int i=0; i<rects.size(); ++i)
9808  allAxes << rects.at(i)->axes();
9809 
9810  for (int i=0; i<allAxes.size(); ++i)
9811  {
9812  if (allAxes.at(i)->selectedParts() != QCPAxis::spNone)
9813  result.append(allAxes.at(i));
9814  }
9815 
9816  return result;
9817 }
9818 
9826 QList<QCPLegend*> QCustomPlot::selectedLegends() const
9827 {
9828  QList<QCPLegend*> result;
9829 
9830  QStack<QCPLayoutElement*> elementStack;
9831  if (mPlotLayout)
9832  elementStack.push(mPlotLayout);
9833 
9834  while (!elementStack.isEmpty())
9835  {
9836  QList<QCPLayoutElement*> subElements = elementStack.pop()->elements(false);
9837  for (int i=0; i<subElements.size(); ++i)
9838  {
9839  if (QCPLayoutElement *element = subElements.at(i))
9840  {
9841  elementStack.push(element);
9842  if (QCPLegend *leg = qobject_cast<QCPLegend*>(element))
9843  {
9844  if (leg->selectedParts() != QCPLegend::spNone)
9845  result.append(leg);
9846  }
9847  }
9848  }
9849  }
9850 
9851  return result;
9852 }
9853 
9863 void QCustomPlot::deselectAll()
9864 {
9865  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
9866  {
9867  QList<QCPLayerable*> layerables = mLayers.at(i)->children();
9868  for (int k=0; k<layerables.size(); ++k)
9869  layerables.at(k)->deselectEvent(0);
9870  }
9871 }
9872 
9886 void QCustomPlot::replot()
9887 {
9888  if (mReplotting) // incase signals loop back to replot slot
9889  return;
9890  mReplotting = true;
9891  emit beforeReplot();
9892  mPaintBuffer.fill(mBackgroundBrush.style() == Qt::SolidPattern ? mBackgroundBrush.color() : Qt::transparent);
9893  QCPPainter painter;
9894  painter.begin(&mPaintBuffer);
9895  if (painter.isActive())
9896  {
9897  painter.setRenderHint(QPainter::HighQualityAntialiasing); // to make Antialiasing look good if using the OpenGL graphicssystem
9898  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::SolidPattern && mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
9899  painter.fillRect(mViewport, mBackgroundBrush);
9900  draw(&painter);
9901  painter.end();
9902  if (mPlottingHints.testFlag(QCP::phForceRepaint))
9903  repaint();
9904  else
9905  update();
9906  } else // might happen if QCustomPlot has width or height zero
9907  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Couldn't activate painter on buffer";
9908  emit afterReplot();
9909  mReplotting = false;
9910 }
9911 
9921 void QCustomPlot::rescaleAxes(bool onlyVisible)
9922 {
9923  if (mPlottables.isEmpty()) return;
9924  bool firstPlottable = true;
9925 
9926  for (int i=0; i<mPlottables.size(); ++i)
9927  {
9928  if (mPlottables.at(i)->realVisibility() || !onlyVisible)
9929  {
9930  mPlottables.at(i)->rescaleAxes(!firstPlottable); // onlyEnlarge disabled on first plottable
9931  firstPlottable = false;
9932  }
9933  }
9934 }
9935 
9967 bool QCustomPlot::savePdf(const QString &fileName, bool noCosmeticPen, int width, int height)
9968 {
9969  bool success = false;
9970  int newWidth, newHeight;
9971  if (width == 0 || height == 0)
9972  {
9973  newWidth = this->width();
9974  newHeight = this->height();
9975  } else
9976  {
9977  newWidth = width;
9978  newHeight = height;
9979  }
9980 
9981  QPrinter printer(QPrinter::ScreenResolution);
9982  printer.setOutputFileName(fileName);
9983  printer.setOutputFormat(QPrinter::PdfFormat);
9984  printer.setFullPage(true);
9985  QRect oldViewport = viewport();
9986  setViewport(QRect(0, 0, newWidth, newHeight));
9987  printer.setPaperSize(viewport().size(), QPrinter::DevicePixel);
9988  QCPPainter printpainter;
9989  if (printpainter.begin(&printer))
9990  {
9991  printpainter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmVectorized);
9992  printpainter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching);
9993  printpainter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNonCosmetic, noCosmeticPen);
9994  printpainter.setWindow(mViewport);
9995  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush &&
9996  mBackgroundBrush.color() != Qt::white &&
9997  mBackgroundBrush.color() != Qt::transparent &&
9998  mBackgroundBrush.color().alpha() > 0) // draw pdf background color if not white/transparent
9999  printpainter.fillRect(viewport(), mBackgroundBrush);
10000  draw(&printpainter);
10001  printpainter.end();
10002  success = true;
10003  }
10004  setViewport(oldViewport);
10005  return success;
10006 }
10007 
10045 bool QCustomPlot::savePng(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale, int quality)
10046 {
10047  return saveRastered(fileName, width, height, scale, "PNG", quality);
10048 }
10049 
10084 bool QCustomPlot::saveJpg(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale, int quality)
10085 {
10086  return saveRastered(fileName, width, height, scale, "JPG", quality);
10087 }
10088 
10120 bool QCustomPlot::saveBmp(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale)
10121 {
10122  return saveRastered(fileName, width, height, scale, "BMP");
10123 }
10124 
10133 QSize QCustomPlot::minimumSizeHint() const
10134 {
10135  return mPlotLayout->minimumSizeHint();
10136 }
10137 
10143 QSize QCustomPlot::sizeHint() const
10144 {
10145  return mPlotLayout->minimumSizeHint();
10146 }
10147 
10153 void QCustomPlot::paintEvent(QPaintEvent *event)
10154 {
10155  Q_UNUSED(event);
10156  QPainter painter(this);
10157  painter.drawPixmap(0, 0, mPaintBuffer);
10158 }
10159 
10166 void QCustomPlot::resizeEvent(QResizeEvent *event)
10167 {
10168  // resize and repaint the buffer:
10169  mPaintBuffer = QPixmap(event->size());
10170  setViewport(rect());
10171  replot();
10172 }
10173 
10183 void QCustomPlot::mouseDoubleClickEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10184 {
10185  emit mouseDoubleClick(event);
10186 
10187  QVariant details;
10188  QCPLayerable *clickedLayerable = layerableAt(event->pos(), false, &details);
10189 
10190  // emit specialized object double click signals:
10191  if (QCPAbstractPlottable *ap = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractPlottable*>(clickedLayerable))
10192  emit plottableDoubleClick(ap, event);
10193  else if (QCPAxis *ax = qobject_cast<QCPAxis*>(clickedLayerable))
10194  emit axisDoubleClick(ax, details.value<QCPAxis::SelectablePart>(), event);
10195  else if (QCPAbstractItem *ai = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10196  emit itemDoubleClick(ai, event);
10197  else if (QCPLegend *lg = qobject_cast<QCPLegend*>(clickedLayerable))
10198  emit legendDoubleClick(lg, 0, event);
10199  else if (QCPAbstractLegendItem *li = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractLegendItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10200  emit legendDoubleClick(li->parentLegend(), li, event);
10201  else if (QCPPlotTitle *pt = qobject_cast<QCPPlotTitle*>(clickedLayerable))
10202  emit titleDoubleClick(event, pt);
10203 
10204  // call double click event of affected layout element:
10205  if (QCPLayoutElement *el = layoutElementAt(event->pos()))
10206  el->mouseDoubleClickEvent(event);
10207 
10208  // call release event of affected layout element (as in mouseReleaseEvent, since the mouseDoubleClick replaces the second release event in double click case):
10209  if (mMouseEventElement)
10210  {
10211  mMouseEventElement->mouseReleaseEvent(event);
10212  mMouseEventElement = 0;
10213  }
10214 
10215  //QWidget::mouseDoubleClickEvent(event); don't call base class implementation because it would just cause a mousePress/ReleaseEvent, which we don't want.
10216 }
10217 
10225 void QCustomPlot::mousePressEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10226 {
10227  emit mousePress(event);
10228  mMousePressPos = event->pos(); // need this to determine in releaseEvent whether it was a click (no position change between press and release)
10229 
10230  // call event of affected layout element:
10231  mMouseEventElement = layoutElementAt(event->pos());
10232  if (mMouseEventElement)
10233  mMouseEventElement->mousePressEvent(event);
10234 
10235  QWidget::mousePressEvent(event);
10236 }
10237 
10247 void QCustomPlot::mouseMoveEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10248 {
10249  emit mouseMove(event);
10250 
10251  // call event of affected layout element:
10252  if (mMouseEventElement)
10253  mMouseEventElement->mouseMoveEvent(event);
10254 
10255  QWidget::mouseMoveEvent(event);
10256 }
10257 
10272 void QCustomPlot::mouseReleaseEvent(QMouseEvent *event)
10273 {
10274  emit mouseRelease(event);
10275  bool doReplot = false;
10276 
10277  if ((mMousePressPos-event->pos()).manhattanLength() < 5) // determine whether it was a click operation
10278  {
10279  if (event->button() == Qt::LeftButton)
10280  {
10281  // handle selection mechanism:
10282  QVariant details;
10283  QCPLayerable *clickedLayerable = layerableAt(event->pos(), true, &details);
10284  bool selectionStateChanged = false;
10285  bool additive = mInteractions.testFlag(QCP::iMultiSelect) && event->modifiers().testFlag(mMultiSelectModifier);
10286  if (clickedLayerable && mInteractions.testFlag(clickedLayerable->selectionCategory()))
10287  {
10288  // a layerable was actually clicked, call its selectEvent:
10289  bool selChanged = false;
10290  clickedLayerable->selectEvent(event, additive, details, &selChanged);
10291  selectionStateChanged |= selChanged;
10292  }
10293  // deselect all other layerables if not additive selection:
10294  if (!additive)
10295  {
10296  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
10297  {
10298  QList<QCPLayerable*> layerables = mLayers.at(i)->children();
10299  for (int k=0; k<layerables.size(); ++k)
10300  {
10301  if (layerables.at(k) != clickedLayerable && mInteractions.testFlag(layerables.at(k)->selectionCategory()))
10302  {
10303  bool selChanged = false;
10304  layerables.at(k)->deselectEvent(&selChanged);
10305  selectionStateChanged |= selChanged;
10306  }
10307  }
10308  }
10309  }
10310  doReplot = true;
10311  if (selectionStateChanged)
10312  emit selectionChangedByUser();
10313  }
10314 
10315  // emit specialized object click signals:
10316  QVariant details;
10317  QCPLayerable *clickedLayerable = layerableAt(event->pos(), false, &details); // for these signals, selectability is ignored, that's why we call this again with onlySelectable set to false
10318  if (QCPAbstractPlottable *ap = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractPlottable*>(clickedLayerable))
10319  emit plottableClick(ap, event);
10320  else if (QCPAxis *ax = qobject_cast<QCPAxis*>(clickedLayerable))
10321  emit axisClick(ax, details.value<QCPAxis::SelectablePart>(), event);
10322  else if (QCPAbstractItem *ai = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10323  emit itemClick(ai, event);
10324  else if (QCPLegend *lg = qobject_cast<QCPLegend*>(clickedLayerable))
10325  emit legendClick(lg, 0, event);
10326  else if (QCPAbstractLegendItem *li = qobject_cast<QCPAbstractLegendItem*>(clickedLayerable))
10327  emit legendClick(li->parentLegend(), li, event);
10328  else if (QCPPlotTitle *pt = qobject_cast<QCPPlotTitle*>(clickedLayerable))
10329  emit titleClick(event, pt);
10330  }
10331 
10332  // call event of affected layout element:
10333  if (mMouseEventElement)
10334  {
10335  mMouseEventElement->mouseReleaseEvent(event);
10336  mMouseEventElement = 0;
10337  }
10338 
10339  if (doReplot || noAntialiasingOnDrag())
10340  replot();
10341 
10342  QWidget::mouseReleaseEvent(event);
10343 }
10344 
10351 void QCustomPlot::wheelEvent(QWheelEvent *event)
10352 {
10353  emit mouseWheel(event);
10354 
10355  // call event of affected layout element:
10356  if (QCPLayoutElement *el = layoutElementAt(event->pos()))
10357  el->wheelEvent(event);
10358 
10359  QWidget::wheelEvent(event);
10360 }
10361 
10369 void QCustomPlot::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
10370 {
10371  // update all axis tick vectors:
10372  QList<QCPAxisRect*> rects = axisRects();
10373  for (int i=0; i<rects.size(); ++i)
10374  {
10375  QList<QCPAxis*> axes = rects.at(i)->axes();
10376  for (int k=0; k<axes.size(); ++k)
10377  axes.at(k)->setupTickVectors();
10378  }
10379 
10380  // recalculate layout:
10381  mPlotLayout->update();
10382 
10383  // draw viewport background pixmap:
10384  drawBackground(painter);
10385 
10386  // draw all layered objects (grid, axes, plottables, items, legend,...):
10387  for (int layerIndex=0; layerIndex < mLayers.size(); ++layerIndex)
10388  {
10389  QList<QCPLayerable*> layerChildren = mLayers.at(layerIndex)->children();
10390  for (int k=0; k < layerChildren.size(); ++k)
10391  {
10392  QCPLayerable *child = layerChildren.at(k);
10393  if (child->realVisibility())
10394  {
10395  painter->save();
10396  painter->setClipRect(child->clipRect().translated(0, -1));
10397  child->applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
10398  child->draw(painter);
10399  painter->restore();
10400  }
10401  }
10402  }
10403 }
10404 
10422 void QCustomPlot::drawBackground(QCPPainter *painter)
10423 {
10424  // Note: background color is handled in individual replot/save functions
10425 
10426  // draw background pixmap (on top of fill, if brush specified):
10427  if (!mBackgroundPixmap.isNull())
10428  {
10429  if (mBackgroundScaled)
10430  {
10431  // check whether mScaledBackground needs to be updated:
10432  QSize scaledSize(mBackgroundPixmap.size());
10433  scaledSize.scale(mViewport.size(), mBackgroundScaledMode);
10434  if (mScaledBackgroundPixmap.size() != scaledSize)
10435  mScaledBackgroundPixmap = mBackgroundPixmap.scaled(mViewport.size(), mBackgroundScaledMode, Qt::SmoothTransformation);
10436  painter->drawPixmap(mViewport.topLeft(), mScaledBackgroundPixmap, QRect(0, 0, mViewport.width(), mViewport.height()) & mScaledBackgroundPixmap.rect());
10437  } else
10438  {
10439  painter->drawPixmap(mViewport.topLeft(), mBackgroundPixmap, QRect(0, 0, mViewport.width(), mViewport.height()));
10440  }
10441  }
10442 }
10443 
10444 
10450 void QCustomPlot::axisRemoved(QCPAxis *axis)
10451 {
10452  if (xAxis == axis)
10453  xAxis = 0;
10454  if (xAxis2 == axis)
10455  xAxis2 = 0;
10456  if (yAxis == axis)
10457  yAxis = 0;
10458  if (yAxis2 == axis)
10459  yAxis2 = 0;
10460 
10461  // Note: No need to take care of range drag axes and range zoom axes, because they are stored in smart pointers
10462 }
10463 
10469 void QCustomPlot::legendRemoved(QCPLegend *legend)
10470 {
10471  if (this->legend == legend)
10472  this->legend = 0;
10473 }
10474 
10481 void QCustomPlot::updateLayerIndices() const
10482 {
10483  for (int i=0; i<mLayers.size(); ++i)
10484  mLayers.at(i)->mIndex = i;
10485 }
10486 
10499 QCPLayerable *QCustomPlot::layerableAt(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *selectionDetails) const
10500 {
10501  for (int layerIndex=mLayers.size()-1; layerIndex>=0; --layerIndex)
10502  {
10503  const QList<QCPLayerable*> layerables = mLayers.at(layerIndex)->children();
10504  double minimumDistance = selectionTolerance()*1.1;
10505  QCPLayerable *minimumDistanceLayerable = 0;
10506  for (int i=layerables.size()-1; i>=0; --i)
10507  {
10508  if (!layerables.at(i)->realVisibility())
10509  continue;
10510  QVariant details;
10511  double dist = layerables.at(i)->selectTest(pos, onlySelectable, &details);
10512  if (dist >= 0 && dist < minimumDistance)
10513  {
10514  minimumDistance = dist;
10515  minimumDistanceLayerable = layerables.at(i);
10516  if (selectionDetails) *selectionDetails = details;
10517  }
10518  }
10519  if (minimumDistance < selectionTolerance())
10520  return minimumDistanceLayerable;
10521  }
10522  return 0;
10523 }
10524 
10536 bool QCustomPlot::saveRastered(const QString &fileName, int width, int height, double scale, const char *format, int quality)
10537 {
10538  QPixmap buffer = toPixmap(width, height, scale);
10539  if (!buffer.isNull())
10540  return buffer.save(fileName, format, quality);
10541  else
10542  return false;
10543 }
10544 
10553 QPixmap QCustomPlot::toPixmap(int width, int height, double scale)
10554 {
10555  // this method is somewhat similar to toPainter. Change something here, and a change in toPainter might be necessary, too.
10556  int newWidth, newHeight;
10557  if (width == 0 || height == 0)
10558  {
10559  newWidth = this->width();
10560  newHeight = this->height();
10561  } else
10562  {
10563  newWidth = width;
10564  newHeight = height;
10565  }
10566  int scaledWidth = qRound(scale*newWidth);
10567  int scaledHeight = qRound(scale*newHeight);
10568 
10569  QPixmap result(scaledWidth, scaledHeight);
10570  result.fill(mBackgroundBrush.style() == Qt::SolidPattern ? mBackgroundBrush.color() : Qt::transparent); // if using non-solid pattern, make transparent now and draw brush pattern later
10571  QCPPainter painter;
10572  painter.begin(&result);
10573  if (painter.isActive())
10574  {
10575  QRect oldViewport = viewport();
10576  setViewport(QRect(0, 0, newWidth, newHeight));
10577  painter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching);
10578  if (!qFuzzyCompare(scale, 1.0))
10579  {
10580  if (scale > 1.0) // for scale < 1 we always want cosmetic pens where possible, because else lines might disappear for very small scales
10581  painter.setMode(QCPPainter::pmNonCosmetic);
10582  painter.scale(scale, scale);
10583  }
10584  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::SolidPattern && mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
10585  painter.fillRect(mViewport, mBackgroundBrush);
10586  draw(&painter);
10587  setViewport(oldViewport);
10588  painter.end();
10589  } else // might happen if pixmap has width or height zero
10590  {
10591  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Couldn't activate painter on pixmap";
10592  return QPixmap();
10593  }
10594  return result;
10595 }
10596 
10609 void QCustomPlot::toPainter(QCPPainter *painter, int width, int height)
10610 {
10611  // this method is somewhat similar to toPixmap. Change something here, and a change in toPixmap might be necessary, too.
10612  int newWidth, newHeight;
10613  if (width == 0 || height == 0)
10614  {
10615  newWidth = this->width();
10616  newHeight = this->height();
10617  } else
10618  {
10619  newWidth = width;
10620  newHeight = height;
10621  }
10622 
10623  if (painter->isActive())
10624  {
10625  QRect oldViewport = viewport();
10626  setViewport(QRect(0, 0, newWidth, newHeight));
10627  painter->setMode(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching);
10628  // warning: the following is different in toPixmap, because a solid background color is applied there via QPixmap::fill
10629  // here, we need to do this via QPainter::fillRect.
10630  if (mBackgroundBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
10631  painter->fillRect(mViewport, mBackgroundBrush);
10632  draw(painter);
10633  setViewport(oldViewport);
10634  } else
10635  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Passed painter is not active";
10636 }
10637 
10638 
10642 
10662 QCPData::QCPData() :
10663  key(0),
10664  value(0),
10665  keyErrorPlus(0),
10666  keyErrorMinus(0),
10667  valueErrorPlus(0),
10668  valueErrorMinus(0)
10669 {
10670 }
10671 
10675 QCPData::QCPData(double key, double value) :
10676  key(key),
10677  value(value),
10678  keyErrorPlus(0),
10679  keyErrorMinus(0),
10680  valueErrorPlus(0),
10681  valueErrorMinus(0)
10682 {
10683 }
10684 
10685 
10689 
10733 QCPGraph::QCPGraph(QCPAxis *keyAxis, QCPAxis *valueAxis) :
10734  QCPAbstractPlottable(keyAxis, valueAxis)
10735 {
10736  mData = new QCPDataMap;
10737 
10738  setPen(QPen(Qt::blue, 0));
10739  setErrorPen(QPen(Qt::black));
10740  setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
10741  setSelectedPen(QPen(QColor(80, 80, 255), 2.5));
10742  setSelectedBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
10743 
10744  setLineStyle(lsLine);
10745  setErrorType(etNone);
10746  setErrorBarSize(6);
10747  setErrorBarSkipSymbol(true);
10748  setChannelFillGraph(0);
10749 }
10750 
10751 QCPGraph::~QCPGraph()
10752 {
10753  delete mData;
10754 }
10755 
10763 void QCPGraph::setData(QCPDataMap *data, bool copy)
10764 {
10765  if (copy)
10766  {
10767  *mData = *data;
10768  } else
10769  {
10770  delete mData;
10771  mData = data;
10772  }
10773 }
10774 
10781 void QCPGraph::setData(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value)
10782 {
10783  mData->clear();
10784  int n = key.size();
10785  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10786  QCPData newData;
10787  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10788  {
10789  newData.key = key[i];
10790  newData.value = value[i];
10791  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
10792  }
10793 }
10794 
10804 void QCPGraph::setDataValueError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &valueError)
10805 {
10806  mData->clear();
10807  int n = key.size();
10808  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10809  n = qMin(n, valueError.size());
10810  QCPData newData;
10811  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10812  {
10813  newData.key = key[i];
10814  newData.value = value[i];
10815  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueError[i];
10816  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueError[i];
10817  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10818  }
10819 }
10820 
10830 void QCPGraph::setDataValueError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &valueErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorPlus)
10831 {
10832  mData->clear();
10833  int n = key.size();
10834  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10835  n = qMin(n, valueErrorMinus.size());
10836  n = qMin(n, valueErrorPlus.size());
10837  QCPData newData;
10838  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10839  {
10840  newData.key = key[i];
10841  newData.value = value[i];
10842  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueErrorMinus[i];
10843  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueErrorPlus[i];
10844  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10845  }
10846 }
10847 
10857 void QCPGraph::setDataKeyError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyError)
10858 {
10859  mData->clear();
10860  int n = key.size();
10861  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10862  n = qMin(n, keyError.size());
10863  QCPData newData;
10864  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10865  {
10866  newData.key = key[i];
10867  newData.value = value[i];
10868  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyError[i];
10869  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyError[i];
10870  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10871  }
10872 }
10873 
10883 void QCPGraph::setDataKeyError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &keyErrorPlus)
10884 {
10885  mData->clear();
10886  int n = key.size();
10887  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10888  n = qMin(n, keyErrorMinus.size());
10889  n = qMin(n, keyErrorPlus.size());
10890  QCPData newData;
10891  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10892  {
10893  newData.key = key[i];
10894  newData.value = value[i];
10895  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyErrorMinus[i];
10896  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyErrorPlus[i];
10897  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10898  }
10899 }
10900 
10910 void QCPGraph::setDataBothError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyError, const QVector<double> &valueError)
10911 {
10912  mData->clear();
10913  int n = key.size();
10914  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10915  n = qMin(n, valueError.size());
10916  n = qMin(n, keyError.size());
10917  QCPData newData;
10918  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10919  {
10920  newData.key = key[i];
10921  newData.value = value[i];
10922  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyError[i];
10923  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyError[i];
10924  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueError[i];
10925  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueError[i];
10926  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10927  }
10928 }
10929 
10939 void QCPGraph::setDataBothError(const QVector<double> &key, const QVector<double> &value, const QVector<double> &keyErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &keyErrorPlus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorMinus, const QVector<double> &valueErrorPlus)
10940 {
10941  mData->clear();
10942  int n = key.size();
10943  n = qMin(n, value.size());
10944  n = qMin(n, valueErrorMinus.size());
10945  n = qMin(n, valueErrorPlus.size());
10946  n = qMin(n, keyErrorMinus.size());
10947  n = qMin(n, keyErrorPlus.size());
10948  QCPData newData;
10949  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
10950  {
10951  newData.key = key[i];
10952  newData.value = value[i];
10953  newData.keyErrorMinus = keyErrorMinus[i];
10954  newData.keyErrorPlus = keyErrorPlus[i];
10955  newData.valueErrorMinus = valueErrorMinus[i];
10956  newData.valueErrorPlus = valueErrorPlus[i];
10957  mData->insertMulti(key[i], newData);
10958  }
10959 }
10960 
10961 
10968 void QCPGraph::setLineStyle(LineStyle ls)
10969 {
10970  mLineStyle = ls;
10971 }
10972 
10979 void QCPGraph::setScatterStyle(const QCPScatterStyle &style)
10980 {
10981  mScatterStyle = style;
10982 }
10983 
10992 void QCPGraph::setErrorType(ErrorType errorType)
10993 {
10994  mErrorType = errorType;
10995 }
10996 
11001 void QCPGraph::setErrorPen(const QPen &pen)
11002 {
11003  mErrorPen = pen;
11004 }
11005 
11009 void QCPGraph::setErrorBarSize(double size)
11010 {
11011  mErrorBarSize = size;
11012 }
11013 
11025 void QCPGraph::setErrorBarSkipSymbol(bool enabled)
11026 {
11027  mErrorBarSkipSymbol = enabled;
11028 }
11029 
11039 void QCPGraph::setChannelFillGraph(QCPGraph *targetGraph)
11040 {
11041  // prevent setting channel target to this graph itself:
11042  if (targetGraph == this)
11043  {
11044  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph is this graph itself";
11045  mChannelFillGraph.clear();
11046  return;
11047  }
11048  // prevent setting channel target to a graph not in the plot:
11049  if (targetGraph && targetGraph->mParentPlot != mParentPlot)
11050  {
11051  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "targetGraph not in same plot";
11052  mChannelFillGraph.clear();
11053  return;
11054  }
11055 
11056  mChannelFillGraph = targetGraph;
11057 }
11058 
11063 void QCPGraph::addData(const QCPDataMap &dataMap)
11064 {
11065  mData->unite(dataMap);
11066 }
11067 
11072 void QCPGraph::addData(const QCPData &data)
11073 {
11074  mData->insertMulti(data.key, data);
11075 }
11076 
11081 void QCPGraph::addData(double key, double value)
11082 {
11083  QCPData newData;
11084  newData.key = key;
11085  newData.value = value;
11086  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
11087 }
11088 
11093 void QCPGraph::addData(const QVector<double> &keys, const QVector<double> &values)
11094 {
11095  int n = qMin(keys.size(), values.size());
11096  QCPData newData;
11097  for (int i=0; i<n; ++i)
11098  {
11099  newData.key = keys[i];
11100  newData.value = values[i];
11101  mData->insertMulti(newData.key, newData);
11102  }
11103 }
11104 
11109 void QCPGraph::removeDataBefore(double key)
11110 {
11111  QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->begin();
11112  while (it != mData->end() && it.key() < key)
11113  it = mData->erase(it);
11114 }
11115 
11120 void QCPGraph::removeDataAfter(double key)
11121 {
11122  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
11123  QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(key);
11124  while (it != mData->end())
11125  it = mData->erase(it);
11126 }
11127 
11135 void QCPGraph::removeData(double fromKey, double toKey)
11136 {
11137  if (fromKey >= toKey || mData->isEmpty()) return;
11138  QCPDataMap::iterator it = mData->upperBound(fromKey);
11139  QCPDataMap::iterator itEnd = mData->upperBound(toKey);
11140  while (it != itEnd)
11141  it = mData->erase(it);
11142 }
11143 
11152 void QCPGraph::removeData(double key)
11153 {
11154  mData->remove(key);
11155 }
11156 
11161 void QCPGraph::clearData()
11162 {
11163  mData->clear();
11164 }
11165 
11166 /* inherits documentation from base class */
11167 double QCPGraph::selectTest(const QPointF &pos, bool onlySelectable, QVariant *details) const
11168 {
11169  Q_UNUSED(details)
11170  if ((onlySelectable && !mSelectable) || mData->isEmpty())
11171  return -1;
11172 
11173  return pointDistance(pos);
11174 }
11175 
11183 void QCPGraph::rescaleAxes(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
11184 {
11185  rescaleKeyAxis(onlyEnlarge, includeErrorBars);
11186  rescaleValueAxis(onlyEnlarge, includeErrorBars);
11187 }
11188 
11196 void QCPGraph::rescaleKeyAxis(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
11197 {
11198  // this code is a copy of QCPAbstractPlottable::rescaleKeyAxis with the only change
11199  // that getKeyRange is passed the includeErrorBars value.
11200  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
11201 
11202  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11203  if (!keyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
11204 
11205  SignDomain signDomain = sdBoth;
11206  if (keyAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic)
11207  signDomain = (keyAxis->range().upper < 0 ? sdNegative : sdPositive);
11208 
11209  bool validRange;
11210  QCPRange newRange = getKeyRange(validRange, signDomain, includeErrorBars);
11211 
11212  if (validRange)
11213  {
11214  if (onlyEnlarge)
11215  {
11216  if (keyAxis->range().lower < newRange.lower)
11217  newRange.lower = keyAxis->range().lower;
11218  if (keyAxis->range().upper > newRange.upper)
11219  newRange.upper = keyAxis->range().upper;
11220  }
11221  keyAxis->setRange(newRange);
11222  }
11223 }
11224 
11232 void QCPGraph::rescaleValueAxis(bool onlyEnlarge, bool includeErrorBars) const
11233 {
11234  // this code is a copy of QCPAbstractPlottable::rescaleValueAxis with the only change
11235  // is that getValueRange is passed the includeErrorBars value.
11236  if (mData->isEmpty()) return;
11237 
11238  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11239  if (!valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid value axis"; return; }
11240 
11241  SignDomain signDomain = sdBoth;
11242  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic)
11243  signDomain = (valueAxis->range().upper < 0 ? sdNegative : sdPositive);
11244 
11245  bool validRange;
11246  QCPRange newRange = getValueRange(validRange, signDomain, includeErrorBars);
11247 
11248  if (validRange)
11249  {
11250  if (onlyEnlarge)
11251  {
11252  if (valueAxis->range().lower < newRange.lower)
11253  newRange.lower = valueAxis->range().lower;
11254  if (valueAxis->range().upper > newRange.upper)
11255  newRange.upper = valueAxis->range().upper;
11256  }
11257  valueAxis->setRange(newRange);
11258  }
11259 }
11260 
11261 /* inherits documentation from base class */
11262 void QCPGraph::draw(QCPPainter *painter)
11263 {
11264  if (!mKeyAxis || !mValueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11265  if (mKeyAxis.data()->range().size() <= 0 || mData->isEmpty()) return;
11266  if (mLineStyle == lsNone && mScatterStyle.isNone()) return;
11267 
11268  // allocate line and (if necessary) point vectors:
11269  QVector<QPointF> *lineData = new QVector<QPointF>;
11270  QVector<QCPData> *pointData = 0;
11271  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
11272  pointData = new QVector<QCPData>;
11273 
11274  // fill vectors with data appropriate to plot style:
11275  getPlotData(lineData, pointData);
11276 
11277  // check data validity if flag set:
11278 #ifdef QCUSTOMPLOT_CHECK_DATA
11279  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it;
11280  for (it = mData->constBegin(); it != mData->constEnd(); ++it)
11281  {
11282  if (QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().key, it.value().value) ||
11283  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().keyErrorPlus, it.value().keyErrorMinus) ||
11284  QCP::isInvalidData(it.value().valueErrorPlus, it.value().valueErrorPlus))
11285  qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "Data point at" << it.key() << "invalid." << "Plottable name:" << name();
11286  }
11287 #endif
11288 
11289  // draw fill of graph:
11290  drawFill(painter, lineData);
11291 
11292  // draw line:
11293  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse)
11294  drawImpulsePlot(painter, lineData);
11295  else if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
11296  drawLinePlot(painter, lineData); // also step plots can be drawn as a line plot
11297 
11298  // draw scatters:
11299  if (pointData)
11300  drawScatterPlot(painter, pointData);
11301 
11302  // free allocated line and point vectors:
11303  delete lineData;
11304  if (pointData)
11305  delete pointData;
11306 }
11307 
11308 /* inherits documentation from base class */
11309 void QCPGraph::drawLegendIcon(QCPPainter *painter, const QRectF &rect) const
11310 {
11311  // draw fill:
11312  if (mBrush.style() != Qt::NoBrush)
11313  {
11314  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
11315  painter->fillRect(QRectF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.width(), rect.height()/3.0), mBrush);
11316  }
11317  // draw line vertically centered:
11318  if (mLineStyle != lsNone)
11319  {
11320  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
11321  painter->setPen(mPen);
11322  painter->drawLine(QLineF(rect.left(), rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0, rect.right()+5, rect.top()+rect.height()/2.0)); // +5 on x2 else last segment is missing from dashed/dotted pens
11323  }
11324  // draw scatter symbol:
11325  if (!mScatterStyle.isNone())
11326  {
11327  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
11328  // scale scatter pixmap if it's too large to fit in legend icon rect:
11329  if (mScatterStyle.shape() == QCPScatterStyle::ssPixmap && (mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().width() > rect.width() || mScatterStyle.pixmap().size().height() > rect.height()))
11330  {
11331  QCPScatterStyle scaledStyle(mScatterStyle);
11332  scaledStyle.setPixmap(scaledStyle.pixmap().scaled(rect.size().toSize(), Qt::KeepAspectRatio, Qt::SmoothTransformation));
11333  scaledStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
11334  scaledStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
11335  } else
11336  {
11337  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
11338  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, QRectF(rect).center());
11339  }
11340  }
11341 }
11342 
11361 void QCPGraph::getPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11362 {
11363  switch(mLineStyle)
11364  {
11365  case lsNone: getScatterPlotData(pointData); break;
11366  case lsLine: getLinePlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11367  case lsStepLeft: getStepLeftPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11368  case lsStepRight: getStepRightPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11369  case lsStepCenter: getStepCenterPlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11370  case lsImpulse: getImpulsePlotData(lineData, pointData); break;
11371  }
11372 }
11373 
11385 void QCPGraph::getScatterPlotData(QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11386 {
11387  if (!pointData) return;
11388  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11389  if (!keyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
11390 
11391  // get visible data range:
11392  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11393  int dataCount = 0;
11394  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11395  if (dataCount > 0)
11396  {
11397  // prepare vectors:
11398  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11399 
11400  // position data points:
11401  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11402  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11403  int i = 0;
11404  while (it != upperEnd)
11405  {
11406  (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
11407  ++i;
11408  ++it;
11409  }
11410  }
11411 }
11412 
11424 void QCPGraph::getLinePlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11425 {
11426  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11427  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11428  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11429  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11430 
11431  // get visible data range:
11432  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11433  int dataCount = 0;
11434  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11435  if (dataCount > 0)
11436  {
11437  lineData->reserve(dataCount+2); // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
11438  lineData->resize(dataCount);
11439  if (pointData)
11440  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11441 
11442  // position data points:
11443  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11444  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11445  int i = 0;
11446  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11447  {
11448  while (it != upperEnd)
11449  {
11450  if (pointData)
11451  (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
11452  (*lineData)[i].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11453  (*lineData)[i].setY(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key()));
11454  ++i;
11455  ++it;
11456  }
11457  } else // key axis is horizontal
11458  {
11459  while (it != upperEnd)
11460  {
11461  if (pointData)
11462  (*pointData)[i] = it.value();
11463  (*lineData)[i].setX(keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key()));
11464  (*lineData)[i].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11465  ++i;
11466  ++it;
11467  }
11468  }
11469  }
11470 }
11471 
11483 void QCPGraph::getStepLeftPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11484 {
11485  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11486  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11487  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11488  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11489 
11490  // get visible data range:
11491  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11492  int dataCount = 0;
11493  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11494  if (dataCount > 0)
11495  {
11496  lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2); // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
11497  lineData->resize(dataCount*2); // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
11498  if (pointData)
11499  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11500 
11501  // position data points:
11502  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11503  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11504  int i = 0;
11505  int ipoint = 0;
11506  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11507  {
11508  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11509  double key;
11510  while (it != upperEnd)
11511  {
11512  if (pointData)
11513  {
11514  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11515  ++ipoint;
11516  }
11517  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11518  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11519  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11520  ++i;
11521  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11522  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11523  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11524  ++i;
11525  ++it;
11526  }
11527  } else // key axis is horizontal
11528  {
11529  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11530  double key;
11531  while (it != upperEnd)
11532  {
11533  if (pointData)
11534  {
11535  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11536  ++ipoint;
11537  }
11538  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11539  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11540  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11541  ++i;
11542  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11543  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11544  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11545  ++i;
11546  ++it;
11547  }
11548  }
11549  }
11550 }
11551 
11563 void QCPGraph::getStepRightPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11564 {
11565  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11566  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11567  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11568  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11569 
11570  // get visible data range:
11571  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11572  int dataCount = 0;
11573  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11574  if (dataCount > 0)
11575  {
11576  lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2); // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for fill
11577  lineData->resize(dataCount*2); // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
11578  if (pointData)
11579  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11580 
11581  // position points:
11582  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11583  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11584  int i = 0;
11585  int ipoint = 0;
11586  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11587  {
11588  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11589  double value;
11590  while (it != upperEnd)
11591  {
11592  if (pointData)
11593  {
11594  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11595  ++ipoint;
11596  }
11597  value = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11598  (*lineData)[i].setX(value);
11599  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11600  ++i;
11601  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11602  (*lineData)[i].setX(value);
11603  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11604  ++i;
11605  ++it;
11606  }
11607  } else // key axis is horizontal
11608  {
11609  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11610  double value;
11611  while (it != upperEnd)
11612  {
11613  if (pointData)
11614  {
11615  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11616  ++ipoint;
11617  }
11618  value = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11619  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11620  (*lineData)[i].setY(value);
11621  ++i;
11622  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11623  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11624  (*lineData)[i].setY(value);
11625  ++i;
11626  ++it;
11627  }
11628  }
11629  }
11630 }
11631 
11643 void QCPGraph::getStepCenterPlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11644 {
11645  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11646  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11647  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11648  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11649 
11650  // get visible data range:
11651  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11652  int dataCount = 0;
11653  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11654  if (dataCount > 0)
11655  {
11656  // added 2 to reserve memory for lower/upper fill base points that might be needed for base fill
11657  // multiplied by 2 because step plot needs two polyline points per one actual data point
11658  lineData->reserve(dataCount*2+2);
11659  lineData->resize(dataCount*2);
11660  if (pointData)
11661  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11662 
11663  // position points:
11664  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11665  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11666  int i = 0;
11667  int ipoint = 0;
11668  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11669  {
11670  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11671  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11672  double key;
11673  if (pointData)
11674  {
11675  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11676  ++ipoint;
11677  }
11678  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11679  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11680  ++it;
11681  ++i;
11682  while (it != upperEnd)
11683  {
11684  if (pointData)
11685  {
11686  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11687  ++ipoint;
11688  }
11689  key = (keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key())-lastKey)*0.5 + lastKey;
11690  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11691  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11692  ++i;
11693  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11694  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11695  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11696  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11697  ++it;
11698  ++i;
11699  }
11700  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastValue);
11701  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastKey);
11702  } else // key axis is horizontal
11703  {
11704  double lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11705  double lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11706  double key;
11707  if (pointData)
11708  {
11709  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11710  ++ipoint;
11711  }
11712  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11713  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11714  ++it;
11715  ++i;
11716  while (it != upperEnd)
11717  {
11718  if (pointData)
11719  {
11720  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11721  ++ipoint;
11722  }
11723  key = (keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key())-lastKey)*0.5 + lastKey;
11724  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11725  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11726  ++i;
11727  lastValue = valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value);
11728  lastKey = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11729  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11730  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11731  ++it;
11732  ++i;
11733  }
11734  (*lineData)[i].setX(lastKey);
11735  (*lineData)[i].setY(lastValue);
11736  }
11737  }
11738 }
11739 
11751 void QCPGraph::getImpulsePlotData(QVector<QPointF> *lineData, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11752 {
11753  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11754  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11755  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11756  if (!lineData) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "null pointer passed as lineData"; return; }
11757 
11758  // get visible data range:
11759  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lower, upper;
11760  int dataCount = 0;
11761  getVisibleDataBounds(lower, upper, dataCount);
11762  if (dataCount > 0)
11763  {
11764  lineData->resize(dataCount*2); // no need to reserve 2 extra points, because there is no fill for impulse plot
11765  if (pointData)
11766  pointData->resize(dataCount);
11767 
11768  // position data points:
11769  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
11770  QCPDataMap::const_iterator upperEnd = upper+1;
11771  int i = 0;
11772  int ipoint = 0;
11773  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11774  {
11775  double zeroPointX = valueAxis->coordToPixel(0);
11776  double key;
11777  while (it != upperEnd)
11778  {
11779  if (pointData)
11780  {
11781  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11782  ++ipoint;
11783  }
11784  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11785  (*lineData)[i].setX(zeroPointX);
11786  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11787  ++i;
11788  (*lineData)[i].setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11789  (*lineData)[i].setY(key);
11790  ++i;
11791  ++it;
11792  }
11793  } else // key axis is horizontal
11794  {
11795  double zeroPointY = valueAxis->coordToPixel(0);
11796  double key;
11797  while (it != upperEnd)
11798  {
11799  if (pointData)
11800  {
11801  (*pointData)[ipoint] = it.value();
11802  ++ipoint;
11803  }
11804  key = keyAxis->coordToPixel(it.key());
11805  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11806  (*lineData)[i].setY(zeroPointY);
11807  ++i;
11808  (*lineData)[i].setX(key);
11809  (*lineData)[i].setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(it.value().value));
11810  ++i;
11811  ++it;
11812  }
11813  }
11814  }
11815 }
11816 
11830 void QCPGraph::drawFill(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
11831 {
11832  if (mLineStyle == lsImpulse) return; // fill doesn't make sense for impulse plot
11833  if (mainBrush().style() == Qt::NoBrush || mainBrush().color().alpha() == 0) return;
11834 
11835  applyFillAntialiasingHint(painter);
11836  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
11837  {
11838  // draw base fill under graph, fill goes all the way to the zero-value-line:
11839  addFillBasePoints(lineData);
11840  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
11841  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
11842  painter->drawPolygon(QPolygonF(*lineData));
11843  removeFillBasePoints(lineData);
11844  } else
11845  {
11846  // draw channel fill between this graph and mChannelFillGraph:
11847  painter->setPen(Qt::NoPen);
11848  painter->setBrush(mainBrush());
11849  painter->drawPolygon(getChannelFillPolygon(lineData));
11850  }
11851 }
11852 
11862 void QCPGraph::drawScatterPlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QCPData> *pointData) const
11863 {
11864  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11865  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11866  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11867 
11868  // draw error bars:
11869  if (mErrorType != etNone)
11870  {
11871  applyErrorBarsAntialiasingHint(painter);
11872  painter->setPen(mErrorPen);
11873  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11874  {
11875  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11876  drawError(painter, valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), pointData->at(i));
11877  } else
11878  {
11879  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11880  drawError(painter, keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), pointData->at(i));
11881  }
11882  }
11883 
11884  // draw scatter point symbols:
11885  applyScattersAntialiasingHint(painter);
11886  mScatterStyle.applyTo(painter, mPen);
11887  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11888  {
11889  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11890  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value), keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key));
11891  } else
11892  {
11893  for (int i=0; i<pointData->size(); ++i)
11894  mScatterStyle.drawShape(painter, keyAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).key), valueAxis->coordToPixel(pointData->at(i).value));
11895  }
11896 }
11897 
11907 void QCPGraph::drawLinePlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
11908 {
11909  // draw line of graph:
11910  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
11911  {
11912  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
11913  painter->setPen(mainPen());
11914  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
11915 
11916  /* Draws polyline in batches, currently not used:
11917  int p = 0;
11918  while (p < lineData->size())
11919  {
11920  int batch = qMin(25, lineData->size()-p);
11921  if (p != 0)
11922  {
11923  ++batch;
11924  --p; // to draw the connection lines between two batches
11925  }
11926  painter->drawPolyline(lineData->constData()+p, batch);
11927  p += batch;
11928  }
11929  */
11930 
11931  // if drawing solid line and not in PDF, use much faster line drawing instead of polyline:
11932  if (mParentPlot->plottingHints().testFlag(QCP::phFastPolylines) &&
11933  painter->pen().style() == Qt::SolidLine &&
11934  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmVectorized)&&
11935  !painter->modes().testFlag(QCPPainter::pmNoCaching))
11936  {
11937  for (int i=1; i<lineData->size(); ++i)
11938  painter->drawLine(lineData->at(i-1), lineData->at(i));
11939  } else
11940  {
11941  painter->drawPolyline(QPolygonF(*lineData));
11942  }
11943  }
11944 }
11945 
11953 void QCPGraph::drawImpulsePlot(QCPPainter *painter, QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
11954 {
11955  // draw impulses:
11956  if (mainPen().style() != Qt::NoPen && mainPen().color().alpha() != 0)
11957  {
11958  applyDefaultAntialiasingHint(painter);
11959  QPen pen = mainPen();
11960  pen.setCapStyle(Qt::FlatCap); // so impulse line doesn't reach beyond zero-line
11961  painter->setPen(pen);
11962  painter->setBrush(Qt::NoBrush);
11963  painter->drawLines(*lineData);
11964  }
11965 }
11966 
11974 void QCPGraph::drawError(QCPPainter *painter, double x, double y, const QCPData &data) const
11975 {
11976  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
11977  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
11978  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return; }
11979 
11980  double a, b; // positions of error bar bounds in pixels
11981  double barWidthHalf = mErrorBarSize*0.5;
11982  double skipSymbolMargin = mScatterStyle.size(); // pixels left blank per side, when mErrorBarSkipSymbol is true
11983 
11984  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
11985  {
11986  // draw key error vertically and value error horizontally
11987  if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth)
11988  {
11989  a = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key-data.keyErrorMinus);
11990  b = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key+data.keyErrorPlus);
11991  if (keyAxis->rangeReversed())
11992  qSwap(a,b);
11993  // draw spine:
11994  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
11995  {
11996  if (a-y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
11997  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y+skipSymbolMargin));
11998  if (y-b > skipSymbolMargin)
11999  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y-skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
12000  } else
12001  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
12002  // draw handles:
12003  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, a, x+barWidthHalf, a));
12004  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, b, x+barWidthHalf, b));
12005  }
12006  if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth)
12007  {
12008  a = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value-data.valueErrorMinus);
12009  b = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value+data.valueErrorPlus);
12010  if (valueAxis->rangeReversed())
12011  qSwap(a,b);
12012  // draw spine:
12013  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
12014  {
12015  if (x-a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
12016  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x-skipSymbolMargin, y));
12017  if (b-x > skipSymbolMargin)
12018  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x+skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
12019  } else
12020  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
12021  // draw handles:
12022  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y-barWidthHalf, a, y+barWidthHalf));
12023  painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y-barWidthHalf, b, y+barWidthHalf));
12024  }
12025  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() is Qt::Horizontal
12026  {
12027  // draw value error vertically and key error horizontally
12028  if (mErrorType == etKey || mErrorType == etBoth)
12029  {
12030  a = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key-data.keyErrorMinus);
12031  b = keyAxis->coordToPixel(data.key+data.keyErrorPlus);
12032  if (keyAxis->rangeReversed())
12033  qSwap(a,b);
12034  // draw spine:
12035  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
12036  {
12037  if (x-a > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
12038  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, x-skipSymbolMargin, y));
12039  if (b-x > skipSymbolMargin)
12040  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x+skipSymbolMargin, y, b, y));
12041  } else
12042  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y, b, y));
12043  // draw handles:
12044  painter->drawLine(QLineF(a, y-barWidthHalf, a, y+barWidthHalf));
12045  painter->drawLine(QLineF(b, y-barWidthHalf, b, y+barWidthHalf));
12046  }
12047  if (mErrorType == etValue || mErrorType == etBoth)
12048  {
12049  a = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value-data.valueErrorMinus);
12050  b = valueAxis->coordToPixel(data.value+data.valueErrorPlus);
12051  if (valueAxis->rangeReversed())
12052  qSwap(a,b);
12053  // draw spine:
12054  if (mErrorBarSkipSymbol)
12055  {
12056  if (a-y > skipSymbolMargin) // don't draw spine if error is so small it's within skipSymbolmargin
12057  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, y+skipSymbolMargin));
12058  if (y-b > skipSymbolMargin)
12059  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, y-skipSymbolMargin, x, b));
12060  } else
12061  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x, a, x, b));
12062  // draw handles:
12063  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, a, x+barWidthHalf, a));
12064  painter->drawLine(QLineF(x-barWidthHalf, b, x+barWidthHalf, b));
12065  }
12066  }
12067 }
12068 
12087 void QCPGraph::getVisibleDataBounds(QCPDataMap::const_iterator &lower, QCPDataMap::const_iterator &upper, int &count) const
12088 {
12089  if (!mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
12090  if (mData->isEmpty())
12091  {
12092  lower = mData->constEnd();
12093  upper = mData->constEnd();
12094  count = 0;
12095  return;
12096  }
12097 
12098  // get visible data range as QMap iterators
12099  QCPDataMap::const_iterator lbound = mData->lowerBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().lower);
12100  QCPDataMap::const_iterator ubound = mData->upperBound(mKeyAxis.data()->range().upper);
12101  bool lowoutlier = lbound != mData->constBegin(); // indicates whether there exist points below axis range
12102  bool highoutlier = ubound != mData->constEnd(); // indicates whether there exist points above axis range
12103 
12104  lower = (lowoutlier ? lbound-1 : lbound); // data point range that will be actually drawn
12105  upper = (highoutlier ? ubound : ubound-1); // data point range that will be actually drawn
12106 
12107  // count number of points in range lower to upper (including them), so we can allocate array for them in draw functions:
12108  QCPDataMap::const_iterator it = lower;
12109  count = 1;
12110  while (it != upper)
12111  {
12112  ++it;
12113  ++count;
12114  }
12115 }
12116 
12132 void QCPGraph::addFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
12133 {
12134  if (!mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key axis"; return; }
12135 
12136  // append points that close the polygon fill at the key axis:
12137  if (mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
12138  {
12139  *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().y());
12140  *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().y());
12141  } else
12142  {
12143  *lineData << upperFillBasePoint(lineData->last().x());
12144  *lineData << lowerFillBasePoint(lineData->first().x());
12145  }
12146 }
12147 
12154 void QCPGraph::removeFillBasePoints(QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
12155 {
12156  lineData->remove(lineData->size()-2, 2);
12157 }
12158 
12173 QPointF QCPGraph::lowerFillBasePoint(double lowerKey) const
12174 {
12175  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
12176  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
12177  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPointF(); }
12178 
12179  QPointF point;
12180  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear)
12181  {
12182  if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft)
12183  {
12184  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12185  point.setY(lowerKey);
12186  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight)
12187  {
12188  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12189  point.setY(lowerKey);
12190  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop)
12191  {
12192  point.setX(lowerKey);
12193  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12194  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12195  {
12196  point.setX(lowerKey);
12197  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12198  }
12199  } else // valueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
12200  {
12201  // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value zero so we just fill all the way
12202  // to the axis which is in the direction towards zero
12203  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
12204  {
12205  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12206  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12207  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
12208  else
12209  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
12210  point.setY(lowerKey);
12211  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12212  {
12213  point.setX(lowerKey);
12214  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12215  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12216  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
12217  else
12218  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
12219  }
12220  }
12221  return point;
12222 }
12223 
12238 QPointF QCPGraph::upperFillBasePoint(double upperKey) const
12239 {
12240  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
12241  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
12242  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPointF(); }
12243 
12244  QPointF point;
12245  if (valueAxis->scaleType() == QCPAxis::stLinear)
12246  {
12247  if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atLeft)
12248  {
12249  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12250  point.setY(upperKey);
12251  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atRight)
12252  {
12253  point.setX(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12254  point.setY(upperKey);
12255  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop)
12256  {
12257  point.setX(upperKey);
12258  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12259  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12260  {
12261  point.setX(upperKey);
12262  point.setY(valueAxis->coordToPixel(0));
12263  }
12264  } else // valueAxis->mScaleType == QCPAxis::stLogarithmic
12265  {
12266  // In logarithmic scaling we can't just draw to value 0 so we just fill all the way
12267  // to the axis which is in the direction towards 0
12268  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical)
12269  {
12270  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12271  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12272  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->right());
12273  else
12274  point.setX(keyAxis->axisRect()->left());
12275  point.setY(upperKey);
12276  } else if (keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atTop || keyAxis->axisType() == QCPAxis::atBottom)
12277  {
12278  point.setX(upperKey);
12279  if ((valueAxis->range().upper < 0 && !valueAxis->rangeReversed()) ||
12280  (valueAxis->range().upper > 0 && valueAxis->rangeReversed())) // if range is negative, zero is on opposite side of key axis
12281  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->top());
12282  else
12283  point.setY(keyAxis->axisRect()->bottom());
12284  }
12285  }
12286  return point;
12287 }
12288 
12298 const QPolygonF QCPGraph::getChannelFillPolygon(const QVector<QPointF> *lineData) const
12299 {
12300  if (!mChannelFillGraph)
12301  return QPolygonF();
12302 
12303  QCPAxis *keyAxis = mKeyAxis.data();
12304  QCPAxis *valueAxis = mValueAxis.data();
12305  if (!keyAxis || !valueAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "invalid key or value axis"; return QPolygonF(); }
12306  if (!mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis) { qDebug() << Q_FUNC_INFO << "channel fill target key axis invalid"; return QPolygonF(); }
12307 
12308  if (mChannelFillGraph.data()->mKeyAxis.data()->orientation() != keyAxis->orientation())
12309  return QPolygonF(); // don't have same axis orientation, can't fill that (Note: if keyAxis fits, valueAxis will fit too, because it's always orthogonal to keyAxis)
12310 
12311  if (lineData->isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
12312  QVector<QPointF> otherData;
12313  mChannelFillGraph.data()->getPlotData(&otherData, 0);
12314  if (otherData.isEmpty()) return QPolygonF();
12315  QVector<QPointF> thisData;
12316  thisData.reserve(lineData->size()+otherData.size()); // because we will join both vectors at end of this function
12317  for (int i=0; i<lineData->size(); ++i) // don't use the vector<<(vector), it squeezes internally, which ruins the performance tuning with reserve()
12318  thisData << lineData->at(i);
12319 
12320  // pointers to be able to swap them, depending which data range needs cropping:
12321  QVector<QPointF> *staticData = &thisData;
12322  QVector<QPointF> *croppedData = &otherData;
12323 
12324  // crop both vectors to ranges in which the keys overlap (which coord is key, depends on axisType):
12325  if (keyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Horizontal)
12326  {
12327  // x is key
12328  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
12329  if (staticData->first().x() > staticData->last().x())
12330  {
12331  int size = staticData->size();
12332  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12333  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
12334  }
12335  if (croppedData->first().x() > croppedData->last().x())
12336  {
12337  int size = croppedData->size();
12338  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12339  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
12340  }
12341  // crop lower bound:
12342  if (staticData->first().x() < croppedData->first().x()) // other one must be cropped
12343  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12344  int lowBound = findIndexBelowX(croppedData, staticData->first().x());
12345  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12346  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
12347  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
12348  // point via linear interpolation:
12349  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12350  double slope;
12351  if (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x() != 0)
12352  slope = (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y())/(croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x());
12353  else
12354  slope = 0;
12355  (*croppedData)[0].setY(croppedData->at(0).y()+slope*(staticData->first().x()-croppedData->at(0).x()));
12356  (*croppedData)[0].setX(staticData->first().x());
12357 
12358  // crop upper bound:
12359  if (staticData->last().x() > croppedData->last().x()) // other one must be cropped
12360  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12361  int highBound = findIndexAboveX(croppedData, staticData->last().x());
12362  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12363  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
12364  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
12365  // point via linear interpolation:
12366  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12367  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
12368  if (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x() != 0)
12369  slope = (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y())/(croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x());
12370  else
12371  slope = 0;
12372  (*croppedData)[li].setY(croppedData->at(li-1).y()+slope*(staticData->last().x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x()));
12373  (*croppedData)[li].setX(staticData->last().x());
12374  } else // mKeyAxis->orientation() == Qt::Vertical
12375  {
12376  // y is key
12377  // similar to "x is key" but switched x,y. Further, lower/upper meaning is inverted compared to x,
12378  // because in pixel coordinates, y increases from top to bottom, not bottom to top like data coordinate.
12379  // if an axis range is reversed, the data point keys will be descending. Reverse them, since following algorithm assumes ascending keys:
12380  if (staticData->first().y() < staticData->last().y())
12381  {
12382  int size = staticData->size();
12383  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12384  qSwap((*staticData)[i], (*staticData)[size-1-i]);
12385  }
12386  if (croppedData->first().y() < croppedData->last().y())
12387  {
12388  int size = croppedData->size();
12389  for (int i=0; i<size/2; ++i)
12390  qSwap((*croppedData)[i], (*croppedData)[size-1-i]);
12391  }
12392  // crop lower bound:
12393  if (staticData->first().y() > croppedData->first().y()) // other one must be cropped
12394  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12395  int lowBound = findIndexAboveY(croppedData, staticData->first().y());
12396  if (lowBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12397  croppedData->remove(0, lowBound);
12398  // set lowest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of first static data
12399  // point via linear interpolation:
12400  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12401  double slope;
12402  if (croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
12403  slope = (croppedData->at(1).x()-croppedData->at(0).x())/(croppedData->at(1).y()-croppedData->at(0).y());
12404  else
12405  slope = 0;
12406  (*croppedData)[0].setX(croppedData->at(0).x()+slope*(staticData->first().y()-croppedData->at(0).y()));
12407  (*croppedData)[0].setY(staticData->first().y());
12408 
12409  // crop upper bound:
12410  if (staticData->last().y() < croppedData->last().y()) // other one must be cropped
12411  qSwap(staticData, croppedData);
12412  int highBound = findIndexBelowY(croppedData, staticData->last().y());
12413  if (highBound == -1) return QPolygonF(); // key ranges have no overlap
12414  croppedData->remove(highBound+1, croppedData->size()-(highBound+1));
12415  // set highest point of cropped data to fit exactly key position of last static data
12416  // point via linear interpolation:
12417  if (croppedData->size() < 2) return QPolygonF(); // need at least two points for interpolation
12418  int li = croppedData->size()-1; // last index
12419  if (croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y() != 0) // avoid division by zero in step plots
12420  slope = (croppedData->at(li).x()-croppedData->at(li-1).x())/(croppedData->at(li).y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y());
12421  else
12422  slope = 0;
12423  (*croppedData)[li].setX(croppedData->at(li-1).x()+slope*(staticData->last().y()-croppedData->at(li-1).y()));
12424  (*croppedData)[li].setY(staticData->last().y());
12425  }
12426 
12427  // return joined:
12428  for (int i=otherData.size()-1; i>=0; --i) // insert reversed, otherwise the polygon will be twisted
12429  thisData << otherData.at(i);
12430  return QPolygonF(thisData);
12431 }
12432 
12440 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
12441 {
12442  for (int i=data->size()-1; i>=0; --i)
12443  {
12444  if (data->at(i).x() < x)
12445  {
12446  if (i<data->size()-1)
12447  return i+1;
12448  else
12449  return data->size()-1;
12450  }
12451  }
12452  return -1;
12453 }
12454 
12462 int QCPGraph::findIndexBelowX(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double x) const
12463 {
12464  for (int i=0; i<data->size(); ++i)
12465  {
12466  if (data->at(i).x() > x)
12467  {
12468  if (i>0)
12469  return i-1;
12470  else
12471  return 0;
12472  }
12473  }
12474  return -1;
12475 }
12476 
12484 int QCPGraph::findIndexAboveY(const QVector<QPointF> *data, double y) const
12485 {
